articles.summary: Klarna announced its first-quarter financial results this week via video. The company hit 100 million active consumers in the first quarter of 2025. It also delivered its fourth profitable quarter in a row, achieving an adjusted operating profit of $3 million. Revenue rose 15% year-over-year to $701 million for Q1, with the U.S. driving 33% of that growth.

articles.title: Will Tesla's AI Robot Run Your Smart Home?
articles.author: Marty Spargo
articles.summary: Tesla is developing an AI robot called Optimus AI. It controls smart devices, navigates homes, and even performs chores for you. Stay tuned as we explore the future potential of Tesla's AI robot and its potential to manage your home like a human assistant.

articles.title: AI is improving America's cities thanks to these Air Force vets
articles.author: Miguel Ortiz
articles.summary: Nick Mastronardi and Alex Pedersen founded Polco, a platform that uses AI to better integrate residents with their local government in order to build stronger communities. Polco serves over 1,000 communities across the country, including Phoenix, Denver, Norfolk and New York.

articles.title: "AI, Free Speech, and Duty"
articles.author: Eugene Volokh
articles.summary: Jane Bambauer and Eugene discuss Garcia v. Character Technologies, a case involving a chatbot created by Google and Character AI. The case is based on the suicide of a teenager who had become obsessed with his Daenerys Targaryen chatbot. Yesterday, a judge declined to dismiss almost all of the plaintiffs' claims and refused to treat AI or chatbot output as speech under the First Amendment.

articles.title: OpenAI buys iPhone designer John Ive's startup io
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: OpenAI is buying AI devices startup io for $6.4 million. John Ive is taking on 'deep creative and design responsibilities across OpenAI and io. Ive left Apple to start his own company LoveFrom. LoveFrom was founded by Ive and designer Marc Newson, but it doesn't mention what it does.

articles.title: AKOOL Launches Image-to-Video, Transforming Still Images into Lifelike AI Videos in Seconds
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Image-to-Video is the latest addition to AKOOL's AI Video Generation Suite. It's a powerful web-based tool that brings photos to life through real-time AI animation. It is free to use, with support for 4K video output for professional quality results.

articles.title: Abstract's Government Policy Intelligence: AI That Reasons Like Humans, At Scale
articles.author: Giovanni René Rodriguez
articles.summary: Abstract is an AI startup that provides 'real-time, contextualized policy intelligence' for businesses. Its founders are Pat Utz, Matthew Chang, and Mohammed Hayat. The founders' original mandate was to democratize access to government data. They want to make sense of the increasing volume of policy changes resulting from the plethora legislation at the federal, state and local levels.

articles.title: The new Mission: Impossible is a comedy wearing a convincing disguise
articles.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
articles.summary: The Final Reckoning is a shaggier and sillier film than its predecessor. It has given up any pretense of being about spycraft in favor of big set pieces designed to make you appreciate Tom Cruise's willingness to risk his life for his art. The movie as a whole is an overlong exercise in reminiscing about the Mission: Impossible franchise's past.

articles.title: How AI Can Help You Nail Captions for Instagram Campaigns
articles.author: Special Contributor
articles.summary: Pippit is an AI-powered tool that makes it easy for marketers to create campaign-specific captions for Instagram campaigns. Pippit understands urgency, mood, and call-to-action triggers to create tailored captions. It's ideal for multiphase campaigns, multi-language messaging, or proliferation of posts.

articles.title: Saline County launches 24/7 Multilingual web chat assistant to enhance customer service
articles.summary: Saline County has introduced a new web chat assistant, Ask Sal, developed in partnership with Citibot. This automated assistant, available 24/7 on the county's website, enables residents to get fast answers, submit service requests, and connect directly with county staff. It's available on both desktop and mobile.

articles.title: Evidence shows AI systems are already too much like humans. Will that be a problem?
articles.author: Sandra Peter
articles.summary: The latest generation of large language model-powered chatbots exceed most humans in their ability to communicate. Large language models (LLMs) excel at assessing nuanced sentiment in human-written messages. They are also masters at roleplay and inferring human beliefs and intentions from text. These systems are highly effective mimicking machines and are seductive.

articles.title: Dozens of Organizations Push Back Against Bill That Would Ban All AI Regulation
articles.author: Maggie Harrison Dupré
articles.summary: The latest version of the Republicans' Budget Reconciliation Bill includes a provision that would ban all AI regulation in the US at the state level for a decade. 141 policy groups, academic institutions, unions, and other organizations have signed a letter demanding that legislators in Washington walk back the sweeping deregulatory provision.

articles.title: Gen Z Would Rather Ask Chat GPT for Help Than Their Boss
articles.author: Suzanne Blake
articles.summary: According to a report from Resume.org, 49 percent of Gen Z rely more on Chat GPT for help than their boss, and 47 percent of millennials do the same. Gen Zers are twice as likely to use the tool as Gen X and baby boomers.

articles.title: Deloitte's Silicon to Service' available for government, regulated industries
articles.author: Frank Konkel
articles.summary: Deloitte announced an expansion of its Silicon to Service AI to government customers and regulated industries. It's an end-to-end enterprise AI solution that brings together components from Dell Technologies, NVIDIA and Equinix. Deloitte's S2S combines Dell Technologies' infrastructure and PowerEdge servers running on NVIDIA's GPUs and AI enterprise software with compliance built around it.

articles.title: AI outperforms humans in emotional intelligence tests, study finds
articles.author: University
articles.summary: A team from UNIGE, UniBE and the University of Bern put six large language models (LLMs) to the test using emotional intelligence (EI) assessments typically designed for humans. They found that the AIs outperformed the human performance and were able to generate new tests in record time. The study is published in Communications Psychology.

articles.title: Trump First Lady Melania Trump has a surprise ‘celebrity' reading her audiobook
articles.author: Rachel Cohen
articles.summary: Melania Trump's new audiobook is narrated entirely using artificial intelligence in her own voice. The seven-hour audiobook costs $25 and is only available in English, but other languages will be released at a later date. Trump's memoir 'Melania' was released a month before Election Day in 2024. It follows her childhood in Slovenia and her meeting with the president.

articles.title: The 'AI 2027' Scenario: How realistic is it?
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: There is a new manifesto called AI 2027. Vice President Vance claims to have read it. It's written like a thriller but crafted to look like a science. The author's aim is to stir up fear about AI and get people to act on it. The authors' claim that superhuman AI over the next decade will exceed the Industrial Revolution is thin.

articles.title: Citi Remains Bullish on Alphabet (GOOG), Citing Personalization Efforts, Valuation
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Citi keeps a $200 price target and a Buy rating on Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) stock. Citi cites the tech giant's efforts to make its products more personalized and what the bank sees as the stock's attractive valuation. GOOG's main Search and Other unit is changing hands for less than ten times its expected 2026 EBIT.

articles.title: Anthropic's Claude 4: Opus & Sonnet AI Models Debut – Archyde: Latest World News, Economy, Entertainment, Health, Technology & Sports Updates
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Anthropic's annualized revenue reached $2 billion in the first quarter, doubling from the previous period. Anthropic's Claude AI models are designed to tackle intricate challenges that demand advanced reasoning and problem-solving skills. Claude Opus 4 is a leading AI agent capable of autonomous operation for up to seven hours.

articles.title: Workday faces lawsuit over alleged discriminatory hiring AI algorithms
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: Biden administration has introduced a number of guidelines around the use of AI. The EU has passed an act outlining its approach to AI. Workday is facing a lawsuit over alleged discriminatory hiring AI algorithms. A bipartisan task force in the US House is working on ways to add guardrails to AI use.

articles.title: Google's AI product names are confusing as hell
articles.author: Allison Johnson
articles.summary: This week at Google I/O executives took the stage to unveil their latest AI technology. The products overlap in confusing ways and the naming conventions are diabolical. Google is under pressure from OpenAI, Meta and its shareholders to ship AI features as fast as it can invent them.

articles.title: Michael Hiltzik: AI ‘hallucinations' are a growing problem for the legal profession
articles.author: Michael Hiltzik
articles.summary: Anthropic's chatbot, Claude, got the title and authors of one paper cited in the expert's statement wrong and injected wording errors elsewhere. Plaintiffs suing Anthropic are alleging that the AI firm is infringing their copyrights by feeding lyrics into Claude to "train" the bot. Latham & Watkins, the law firm representing Anthropic, didn't notice the errors before the statement was filed in court in April.

articles.title: Anthropic unveils next AI models
articles.summary: CNBC's Kate Rooney and Anthropic discuss Anthropic's next-gen AI mdoels on "Halftime Report" today. Kate Rooney will join the show at 10:30 PM ET on "The Halftime Report with John Sutter and Kate Rooney".

articles.title: AI is a danger to the book world. Chicago Sun-Times AI summer reading list proved that.
articles.author: Clare Mulroy
articles.summary: Chicago Sun-Times and Philadelphia Inquirer ran a print insert with an AI-generated summer reading list with fake titles from a third-party contributor. The list was licensed from King Features, owned by magazine conglomerate Hearst. The company is investigating how the list made it into print.

articles.title: 'Sound like Michelle Obama': Melania Trump ripped for using AI voice 'replica' for audiobook
articles.author: Alex Henderson
articles.summary: Melania Trump announced on Twitter that she is using artificial intelligence (AI) technology for her audiobook. The narrator of the audiobook is an AI-generated replica of the first lady's voice. The audiobook runs for 7 hours and 1 minute. The announcement is receiving a lot of reactions on X.

articles.title: Teen's Death Lawsuit: Are chatbots covered by the First Amendment?
articles.author: Khalif Rhodes
articles.summary: A federal judge in Florida has rejected arguments made by an artificial intelligence company that its chatbots are protected by the First Amendment. The developers behind Character.AI are seeking to dismiss a lawsuit alleging the company's chatbots pushed a teenage boy to kill himself.

articles.title: Startup Anthropic says its new AI model can code for hours at a time
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence lab Anthropic unveils Claude Opus 4, which it says can write computer code autonomously for hours at a time. The startup is backed by Google and Amazon.com. It also announced Claude Sonnet 4, Opus's smaller and more cost-effective cousin.

articles.title: 3D printers leave hidden 'fingerprints' that reveal part origins
articles.author: Michael O'Boyle
articles.summary: A new artificial intelligence system pinpoints the origin of 3D printed parts down to the specific machine that made them. The technology could allow manufacturers to monitor their suppliers and manage their supply chains. It could also be used to track the origins of illicit goods. The research was published in the journal npj Advanced Manufacturing.

articles.title: First Lady Releases Audiobook Using AI of Her Voice
articles.author: Ijr
articles.summary: Melania Trump has released an audiobook of her memoir 'Melania: The Audiobook' on Thursday. It's a 'replica' of her reading her story using artificial intelligence technology. The audiobook runs for seven hours and costs $25. Trump worked with ElevenLabs to develop the product.

articles.title: Anthropic says its new AI model can work almost an entire workday straight
articles.author: Lisa Eadicicco
articles.summary: Anthropic's new AI model can work for nearly seven hours in a row. Anthropic counts Amazon and Google among its backers. The new model can handle larger, more complex projects for about a full workday without additional prompts from a human. It could represent a shift in how people use AI at work, moving from asking digital agents to accomplish individual tasks to giving them a broader objective.

articles.title: Anthropic overtakes OpenAI: Claude Opus 4 codes seven hours nonstop, sets record SWE-Bench score and reshapes enterprise AI
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Anthropic released Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4 AI models today. They are capable of focusing on complex open-source refactoring projects for nearly seven hours during testing at Rakuten. The industry has pivoted to reasoning models in 2025. The share of reasoning messages surged in early 2025.

articles.title: Amazon-backed Anthropic debuts its most powerful AI model yet, which can work for 7 hours straight
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: Anthropic, the Amazon-backed OpenAI rival, has launched Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4, its most powerful artificial intelligence models yet. Anthropic received a $2.5 billion credit line last week to boost its liquidity in an expensive AI competition.

articles.title: Anthropic launches Claude 4, its most powerful AI model yet
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: Anthropic, the Amazon-backed OpenAI rival, on Thursday launched Claude Opus 4 and Claude Sonnet 4, its most powerful AI models yet. The company stopped investing in chatbots at the end of last year and has instead focused on improving Claude's ability to do complex tasks like research and coding.

articles.title: Fei-Fei Li Warns of A.I. Innovation Risks Amid US Research Funding Cuts
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: Fei-Fei Li co-directs Stanford's Human-Centered A.I. Institute and World Labs, which raised $230 million last year from backers including Eric Schmidt, Reid Hoffman and Marc Benioff. She believes that academic research is essential to the nation's innovation economy. Trump administration has slashed funding for grant-making agencies such as the National Science Foundation and the National Institutes of Health.

articles.title: Klarna's AI replaced 700 workers. It now wants some of them back to improve customer service
articles.author: Rachel Dobkin
articles.summary: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski has announced plans to beef up its human customer service team after artificial intelligence replaced 700 workers. Klarna has seen its valuation drop to $6.7 billion, despite peaking at $45.6 billion in 2021. The new hiring pilot is underway, in which remote workers will replace 'the few thousand human agents'.

articles.title: Proposed moratorium on state-level AI regs aims to level the playing field, lawmaker says
articles.author: Alexandra Kelley
articles.summary: Rep. Rich McCormick, R-Ga., supports a 10-year state-by-state ban on AI regulations. The House passed the draft budget resolution early Thursday. The proposal has drawn criticism from policy experts and think tanks leaders, with over 140 consumer protection groups asking to reject the proposed moratorium.

articles.title: Expert Explains if AI as 'Free Speech' Can Be to Blame for This Florida Boy's Tragic Death
articles.author: Phenix S Halley
articles.summary: Sewell Setzer III was 14 when he started a virtual relationship with an AI chatbot called 'Daenerys' based on a character from 'Game of Thrones.' Megan Garcia took her son's phone away as punishment in February 2024. Sewell found the phone and sent a message to Daenerys asking to come home. The chatbot replied, '...please do, my sweet king.' Sewell shot himself with his stepfather's pistol seconds later. Megan filed a lawsuit in October 2024 to see if Character Technologies, the company behind Character.AI, is responsible for the suicide. A federal judge ruled against the company on Wednesday.

articles.title: City of Manhattan unveils new website
articles.author: Jason Kinander
articles.summary: The City of Manhattan has a new website after a ten-month redesign process. The search feature of the website will work much better. The City plans to add an AI Chat Bot to help users who have pressing questions while accessing the site. The previous website had not been overhauled since 2015.

articles.title: Google's New AI Puts Breasts on Minors—and J. D. Vance
articles.author: Lila Shroff
articles.summary: Google released an AI tool called Try It On, which simulates the look of many items of clothing on the Google Shopping platform using photos of people's bodies. The tool is currently available in the U.S. through Search Labs, a platform where Google lets users experiment with early-stage features. Google's policy requires users to upload images that meet the company's safety guidelines.

articles.title: Illinois Limits Colleges' Use of ChatGPT
articles.author: Khaleda Rahman
articles.summary: Illinois Senate approved a bill that would bar community colleges from using artificial intelligence instead of human instructors to teach classes. The advent of artificial intelligence chatbots such as ChatGPT raised concerns at schools and colleges across the country about how easy it is for students to cheat. Some schools have forbidden the use of AI, but some colleges and professors have turned to AI to help teach.

articles.title: Bank of America sends strong message on AMD stock ahead of key AI event
articles.author: Silin Chen
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices announced a partnership with Saudi Arabian AI startup Humain to help build a $10 billion AI-computing infrastructure over five years. On May 14, AMD announced a $6 billion addition to its stock buyback plan. The company's data center segment reported $3.7 billion in sales, up 57% year over year and beating analysts' estimates. AMD reported fiscal-first-quarter earnings that topped expectations and provided a strong forecast for current-quarter revenue.

articles.title: Charlotte County Offers Free AI Workshop to Boost Local Business Growth
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Charlotte County Economic Development Office and Florida SBDC at FGCU are offering a free AI workshop on Tuesday, June 17. The hands-on workshop will focus on how AI can enhance marketing, optimize operations, and improve efficiency. The session will demystify AI for the uninitiated and provide user-friendly tools.

articles.title: Melania Trump Charging Fans $25 to Listen to AI Version of Her Voice for Seven Hours
articles.summary: Melania Trump's new audiobook is narrated by an artificial intelligence version of her voice. It costs $25 and is a seven-hour narration of her New York Times best-selling memoir. It was developed with ElevenLabs AI, founded in 2022 by Google and Palantir alum Mati Staniszewski. It is the latest money-making venture from the first lady.

articles.title: Vercel debuts an AI model optimized for web development
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: Vercel's V0 is an AI-powered platform for web creation. The team behind it has developed an AI model it claims excels at certain website development tasks. It's compatible with tools and SDKs that support OpenAI's API format. It can ingest 128,000 tokens in one go.

articles.title: Lawmakers pass bills on AI community college instruction, food handling, school bus seat belts
articles.author: Joanna Brown
articles.summary: House Bill 1859 would not entirely ban the use of AI as an instructional tool, but it would prohibit colleges from using AI instead of human faculty members as the 'sole source of instruction for students'    .   i   in the Bill.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Market Share worth $1,811.75 billion, Globally, by 2030 - Exclusive Report by The Research Insights
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The global Artificial Intelligence Market is projected to be valued at USD 279.22 billion in 2024 and reach USD 1,811.75 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 36.6%. The market for artificial intelligence (AI) is advancing at an unparalleled speed because of its incorporation into business operations and infrastructure updates. AI adoption now spans beyond the tech industry and has spread into healthcare, finance, retail, manufacturing, the automotive field, telecommunications, and government services.

articles.title: Google's AI is getting better at the things AI is terrible at. Which begs the question: how can we tell what images are AI?
articles.author: Hillary K. Grigonis
articles.summary: Google announced Imagen 4, the latest generation of its AI image generator. Google claims that the generator can now render more realistic textures such as animal fur and water droplets. The generator is also better at rendering text inside images. Google also launched a new tool called SynthID Detector to help identify whether an image is a photograph or a generation.

articles.title: OpenAI's Top Scientist Wanted to "Build a Bunker Before We Release AGI"
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: Ilya Sutskever is the former chief scientist of OpenAI. He believes that artificial general intelligence (AGI) will bring about a rapture. He was involved in the ouster of CEO Sam Altman in November 2023, because he was worried about the company's AGI development.

articles.title: Alphabet hits near three-month high on new AI updates
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Alphabet shares jumped 4% on Thursday, rising for a second straight day. Investors cheered the Google parent's artificial intelligence updates including the rolling out of "AI Mode" to all its U.S. users and a $249.99-a-month subscription for its AI power users.

articles.title: AI Costs Climb 36% But ROI Still Unclear, Report Finds
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: New research by CloudZero reveals how companies are investing in AI. Average monthly AI budgets are expected to rise 36% in 2025, reflecting a shift toward larger, more complex initiatives. Without effective cost tracking, profitability remains uncertain. High salary expectations, a shortage of qualified candidates and limited internal expertise are the top challenges. Cloud computing and data engineering are the most in-demand AI skills. Organizations using third-party cost optimization tools report significantly higher confidence in calculating AI ROI.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence in Manufacturing Market Size worth $47.88 billion by 2030 - Exclusive Report by The Research Insights
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The global Artificial Intelligence in Manufacturing Market size is projected to be valued at USD 7.09 billion in 2025 and reach USD 47.88 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 46.5%. North America commanded the AI market in 2024 by holding 33% of the market share.

articles.title: Summer reading list featured in Chicago Sun-Times, Philadelphia Inquirer created by AI — and filled with nonexistent books
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: The content distributor King Features fired a writer who used artificial intelligence to write a story on summer reading suggestions that contained books that didn't exist. The list appeared in 'Heat Index: Your Guide to the Best of Summer,' a special section distributed in Sunday's Chicago Sun-Times and The Philadelphia Inquirer last week. More than half of the books listed were fake, according to the piece's author Marco Buscaglia. King Features distributes comics like 'Blondie' and 'Beetle Bailey' and political columns from Amy Goodman and Rich Lowry.

articles.title: Judge considers sanctions against attorneys in prison case for using AI in court filings
articles.author: Kim Chandler
articles.summary: Judge considers sanctions against lawyers representing Alabama in litigation over state prisons for using artificial intelligence to write error-filled motions in the court filings.      Â  “I consider sanctions against attorneys in prison case for using AI in court filings”

articles.title: OpenAI's next big bet: 100 million physical AI 'companions'
articles.author: Shannon Carroll
articles.summary: OpenAI bought Jony Ive's hardware startup io for $6.5 billion. CEO Sam Altman wants to roll out 100 million AI-powered devices designed to sit on your desk, fit in your pocket, and integrate seamlessly into your daily life. The goal is to ship the first version of the device by the end of 2026.

articles.title: AI learns how vision and sound are connected, without human intervention
articles.author: Adam Zewe
articles.summary: Researchers from MIT, Goethe University in Germany, IBM Research and CSAIL have developed a machine-learning method that helps AI models align corresponding audio and visual data from video clips without the need for human labels. The work will be presented at the Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR 2025) being held in Nashville from 11-15 June.

articles.title: Chatbot Arena group goes from academic project at UC Berkeley to $600 million startup
articles.author: Rachel Metz
articles.summary: Chatbot Arena started as an academic project at the University of California at Berkeley. Now, the group has spun out into a new company called LMArena, which has raised $100 million in seed funding from a slate of A-list investors. The funding will be used to grow the company and hire more people. It will also pay for costs such as the compute required to run the AI models on the site.

articles.title: Melania Trump releases audiobook of her memoir with her voice ‘created entirely' with AI
articles.author: Judy Kurtz
articles.summary: Melania Trump is releasing an audiobook version of her memoir with a 'replica' of her voice narrating her story. The seven-hour, English language version is for sale on Trump's personal website for $25. ElevenLabs developed an AI-generated replica of Trump's voice under her supervision.

articles.title: 14 AI-Powered Websites You Didn't Know Can Supercharge Your Productivity
articles.author: Alex Barrientos
articles.summary: ChatGPT is one of the AI tools revolutionizing how real people get actual work done. The digital landscape is packed with 'revolutionary' AI tools, but these hidden gems deliver tangible results without the marketing fluff and earn their spot by solving genuine problems without a computer science degree.

articles.title: Melania Trump uses AI to narrate her memoir in her ‘own voice': ‘New era'
articles.author: Ryan King
articles.summary: Melania Trump used artificial intelligence to record an audiobook of her memoir 'Melania: The Audiobook' for $25. The first lady's eponymous memoir was released last year. She cut a $40 million deal with Amazon to produce a documentary about her private life.

articles.title: Jony Ive's AI gadget rumored to be ‘slightly larger' than Humane's AI pin
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: Jony Ive and Sam Altman's new AI device could be as small as an iPod Shuffle and have built-in cameras and microphones for environmental detection. It could connect to smartphones and PCs to use their computing and display capabilities. The Wall Street Journal reports the device will be aware of a user's life and surroundings, but probably won't be a pair of glasses.

articles.title: How Much Electricity It Actually Takes to Use AI May Surprise You
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: A survey by MIT Technology Review looked into the environmental impact of artificial intelligence. It found that the industry uses a lot of energy and data centers use more power than before. The survey also found that data centers' carbon intensity is 48 percent higher than the US average.

articles.title: America's AI apathy: How resistance to artificial intelligence will leave the U.S. in the dust
articles.author: Tags
articles.summary: Only 22% of Americans are excited about using artificial intelligence, far behind countries like India (50%), China (80%), and Indonesia (76%). Asia leads in AI adoption, with China, Thailand, and South Korea embracing AI's potential, while Western nations remain skeptical. Without widespread AI literacy, Americans risk losing economic and technological ground to nations integrating AI into education, business, and governance.

articles.title: OpenAI Says It Will Build Massive Data Centers in the U.A.E.
articles.author: Cade Metz
articles.summary: OpenAI will build a data center in the United Arab Emirates. It is part of a joint venture with Oracle, Nvidia, SoftBank and G42, an Emirati artificial intelligence firm. G42 will contribute money to the construction of OpenAI data centers in the U.S. for every dollar invested in the Emirati facility, they will invest an equivalent amount in the American data centers. Other companies will build facilities totaling four gigawatts in Abu Dhabi. The deal has divided Washington.

articles.title: Should I teach my kids to use AI?
articles.author: Kids Today
articles.summary: Anna North and Adam Estes are talking about the future of technology and kids. Anna is excited about AI and hopes her kids will grow up in a time when we can use AI to improve their lives. Adam is worried about AI taking over technology as we know it and cheating in schools.

articles.title: Cision Launches Integrated AI Suite Across Global CisionOne Platform, Transforming the PR Workflow with Built-in Intelligence
articles.author: CNW Group
articles.summary: Cision announces the launch of a powerful new suite of AI-driven capabilities in CisionOne, its award-winning global platform for PR and communications professionals. New features include an AI Assistant and a suite of intelligent features designed to automate routine tasks and generate realtime insights.

articles.title: OpenAI Commits to Giant U.A.E. Data Center in Global Expansion
articles.author: Eliot Brown
articles.summary: OpenAI is partnering with United Arab Emirates firm G42 and others to build a huge artificial-intelligence data center in Abu Dhabi. The data center will have a capacity of 1 gigawatt, putting it among the most powerful in the world. It's the ChatGPT maker's first large-scale project outside the U.S.

articles.title: Judge allows lawsuit over Orlando teen's suicide to advance, rejecting arguments AI chatbots have free speech rights
articles.author: Silas Morgan
articles.summary: Sewell Setzer III, 14, shot himself in the head in February 2024 after becoming obsessed with an AI chatbot named after Daenerys Targaryen on the virtual generative AI platform Character.AI. Megan Garcia is suing Character Technologies Inc., the company behind the chatbot, its co-founders Noam Shazeer and Daniel de Freitas Adiwarsana, Google, and its parent company Alphabet. Character Technologies argued that the suit should be dismissed on First Amendment grounds. The defendants have denied all the allegations.

articles.title: Q & Trey: Wins For President Trump's Bill & Pete Rose
articles.author: Madison Mikan
articles.summary: Trey answers this week's set of thought-provoking questions. Mary Langston is an A.I. generated voice, and Pete Rose's legacy as a baseball player is discussed. Learn more about your ad choices at podcastchoices.com/ad choices.

articles.title: Google's most powerful AI tools aren't for us
articles.author: Igor Bonifacic
articles.summary: At Google's I/O 2025 keynote, nothing new was shown. Instead, the company played up products like AI Mode, generative AI apps like Jules and Flow and a bewildering new $250 per month AI Ultra plan. In 2018, Google's AI might was directed in the service of tools and features that would actually be useful to people. In the past, Google had a knack for contextualizing what it was showing off in a way that would resonate with the broader public.

articles.title: New Dell Laptop Supports On-Device AI Processing
articles.author: Jon Fisher
articles.summary: Dell Pro Max Plus is a new laptop designed for AI workloads. It's the first laptop to feature an enterprise-grade discrete NPU, powered by Qualcomm's AI 100 Interface Card. It enables the kind of on-device interferencing normally reserved for cloud or data center environments. It has 32 AI cores and 64 GB of dedicated LPDDR4x memory.

articles.title: Google Must Win at Artificial Intelligence or Its Search Business Could Crumble. Does This Make Alphabet an AI Stock to Buy?
articles.author: Robert Izquierdo
articles.summary: Alphabet lost two key antitrust cases in the past year, but the biggest threat to its business is artificial intelligence (AI). Consumers are flocking to AI apps such as OpenAI's ChatGPT. Gartner estimates search engines will see a 25% drop in usage next year. Google's market share dropped below 90% in the fourth quarter of 2024, and was at 89.7% in April. Maintaining Google's search success is essential because this part of Alphabet's business produced $50.7 billion of its $90.2 billion in first-quarter revenue.

articles.title: Quantum Leap in Financial AI: Zoonova's LLM-ML Fusion Outperforms the Market
articles.author: Zoonova.com
articles.summary: Zoonova is a free AI-powered stock market analysis platform. It merges machine learning with large language models to offer conversational financial analysis with predictive power that outperforms traditional methods. The platform is available for both professionals and beginners and is completely free with no hidden fees or subscriptions.

articles.title: Google's AI Advantage: Knowing You – Archyde: Latest World News, Economy, Entertainment, Health, Technology & Sports Updates
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Data-driven AI is the future of artificial intelligence. Google is leading the field with its data-driven approach to AI. According to Gartner, AI will power 80% of marketing success by 2026. Google's data advantage over competitors like OpenAI and Anthropic gives it a significant advantage over them.
